title: Unexpected end of request content
body:
Recently I've been getting a bunch of errors that look like this:

```
2020-09-22 23:35:16.5956|ERROR|29|Connection id "0HM2VA0GMHQ6L", Request id "0HM2VA0GMHQ6L:00000002": An unhandled exception was thrown by the application. Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.BadHttpRequestException: Unexpected end of request content.
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.BadHttpRequestException.Throw(RequestRejectionReason reason)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Http1ContentLengthMessageBody.ReadAsyncInternal(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpRequestStream.ReadAsyncInternal(Memory`1 buffer, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.IO.StreamReader.ReadBufferAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.IO.StreamReader.ReadToEndAsyncInternal()
   at Nethermind.Runner.Startup.<>c__DisplayClass3_0.<<Configure>b__2>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpProtocol.ProcessRequests[TContext](IHttpApplication`1 application)
2020-09-22 23:35:19.5357|ERROR|28|Connection id "0HM2VA0GMHQ6N", Request id "0HM2VA0GMHQ6N:00000002": An unhandled exception was thrown by the application. Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.BadHttpRequestException: Unexpected end of request content.
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.BadHttpRequestException.Throw(RequestRejectionReason reason)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Http1ContentLengthMessageBody.ReadAsyncInternal(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpRequestStream.ReadAsyncInternal(Memory`1 buffer, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.IO.StreamReader.ReadBufferAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.IO.StreamReader.ReadToEndAsyncInternal()
   at Nethermind.Runner.Startup.<>c__DisplayClass3_0.<<Configure>b__2>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpProtocol.ProcessRequests[TContext](IHttpApplication`1 application)
```

But there's not enough details in the request for me to know what's causing it...those connection ID numbers and request ID numbers mean nothing to me... any idea how I might narrow this down?

This is an .NET Core issue that we have reported long time ago - it is thrown when client closes connection while server is still responding and should be harmless but it logs the scary messages. Did it cause any of your requests to fail?
Connection ID and Request ID in this case are internal identifiers of .NET Core / Kestrel.

.NET 5 will be released in November if everything goes well so I would not chase this further before upgrading to the next version. If causing trouble beyond logs let me know. I think we can disable this in NLog
I can't say for sure if it's causing requests to fail or not, it's an archive node, I haven't had reports of issues, yet.

Hmmm it could be related to `dshackle` again...

https://github.com/emeraldpay/dshackle/issues/57
@MysticRyuujin would you try with version 1.8.106 - @LukaszRozmej can give you more details on the changes that should improve the throughput

I've not been told there's been any progress on this, I've posted examples of the issue still occuring after it was marked as fixes, so idk

`Version      : 1.9.14-0-25aab8245-20201103/X64-Linux/Core3.1.5`


I've seen this when pointing Lighthouse, a beacon chain client, at Nethermind.

```
eth1_1                      | 2020-11-17 15:33:11.5312|Connection id "0HM4B0PSBUPFD", Request id "0HM4B0PSBUPFD:00000001": An unhandled exception was thrown by the application. Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.BadHttpRequestException: Unexpected end of request content.
eth1_1                      |    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.BadHttpRequestException.Throw(RequestRejectionReason reason)

eth1_1                      | --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
eth1_1                      |    at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.HttpProtocol.ProcessRequests[TContext](IHttpApplication`1 application)
eth1_1                      | 2020-11-17 15:33:11.5455|Executing JSON RPC call net_version with params
```

Is there a way I can just turn these off or something?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8877131/115739130-44fd5c00-a353-11eb-887f-2279e74a5a06.png)
